## Lecturing {.centered background-color="#314f4f"}

### is a process by which knowledge is transferred from the teacher [(expert)]{.yellow} to young learners[(students)]{.yellow}. Unfortunately, there is [no single magical formula]{.pink} for that but still quite possible by following a series of steps and procedures which I hope will be made part of this training.

##  {.centered background-color="#314f4f"}

**Lecturer job:lessen student fears and encourage students to pursue deeper understanding**

a- [These include several teaching and curriculum approaches that can be integrated into typical quantitative methods classes.]{.yellow}

b- integration during the class;

-   expanded opportunities for two-way communication;

-   developing co-ownership of the course along with the students;

-   alternating lecture with small-group work to aid in learning difficult topics.

## Summary {.centered background-color="#314f4f"}

-   [**What one thing did you learn today?**]{.yellow}

-   **How does today's lesson impact your understanding?**

-   [**How would you summarize today's lecture for someone who wasn't here?**]{.yellow}

-   **What was the most significant learning from today's lecture?**

-   [**What was the most difficult concept in today's lecture?**]{.yellow}

-   **What should I review further in our next lecture?**

-   [**What was one thing you were unsure about in the lecture ?**]{.yellow}

-   **Clarify areas of confusion**
